alert.note: Alert for Pecos (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 18 at 6:04PM CDT until further notice by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Texas, including the following counties, Jeff Davis, Pecos and Reeves. * WHEN...Until 915 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 604 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Toyah Creek, Coyanosa Draw, Cherry Creek, Sandia Creek, Barrilla Draw, Canyon Creek, Hackberry Draw, Ninemile Draw and Madera Canyon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Balmorhea, Saragosa, Balmorhea Lake, Balmorhea State Park, Verhalen and Toyahvale. Including Interstate 10 between mile markers 190 and 234 - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
